That's raising questions about whether other countries are in similar trouble.
NPR's Jim Zarroli is in Brussels, where European leaders were meeting on Friday.
Jim, thanks very much for being with us.
Hi, Scott.

I mean, you know, in the United States we've seen this huge run-up in stock prices for more than a year.
The economy's recovering.
We had those good job numbers yesterday.
And yet, you know, in the past few days all of the major stock indexes have just seen their gains wiped out for the year.
We had that big, strange drop in the Dow on Thursday that federal regulators are looking into.
